title: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes. JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes with names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd' etc.
OB: When opening the All types dialog in JDK 1.4, the list of classes includes obfuscated classes with names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd' etc.
EB: The All types dialog in JDK 1.4 should not display obfuscated classes with names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd' etc.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the All types dialog in JDK 1.4.
2. Observe that the dialog shows obfuscated classes with names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd' etc.

To resolve the issue, I suggest the following:
a) Sort the lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter.
b) Filter out obfuscated classes completely.
